sentence: Again, on Jan. 10, Hannity texted Meadows and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), expressing some anxiety over a conversation he had had with Trump that day.
author: Josh Kovensky
title: ‘No More Crazies’: Trump’s Final Days In Office, As Documented By The Jan. 6 Committee

sentence: pic.twitter.com/lyPMbe5WbF — Joel Lawson (@JoelLawsonDC) July 27, 2021 Just a day later, Jim Jordan was pressed again by another reporter about whether or not he spoke to Trump on Jan. 6 and more specifically, when.
title: White House Jan. 6 call log confirms what Jim Jordan

sentence: Related: Who’s who: A rolling guide to the targets of the Jan. 6 committee According to ABC, GOP House Leader Kevin McCarthy and Reps. Jim Jordan of Ohio and Scott Perry of Pennsylvania have had “no follow-up discussions” about their cooperation since receiving their respective subpoenas.
title: Maybe there won't be subpoenas for GOP lawmakers from Jan. 6 probe but that doesn't spell doom

sentence: The select committee has already attempted to secure voluntary cooperation from three Republican lawmakers: Rep. Scott Perry (Pa.), Rep. Jim Jordan (Ohio) and GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy.
title: The Jan. 6 panel had cooled focus on GOP lawmakers. Then Brooks happened.

sentence: Meadows’ close friend, Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio, suggests in a late text on Jan. 5, 2021 — the day before Congress was due to certify Biden’s victory — that Vice President Mike Pence “should call out all electoral votes that he believes are unconstitutional as no electoral votes at all.” Meadows texted back in the early hours of Jan. 6: “I have pushed for this.
author: FARNOUSH AMIRI
title: Official: Meadows had been warned of possible 1/6 violence

sentence: Meadows’ former colleague and close friend, Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio, suggests in a late text on Jan. 5 — the day before Congress was due to certify Joe Biden's electoral victory — that Vice President Mike Pence “should call out all electoral votes that he believes are unconstitutional as no electoral votes at all.” Politics Politics from around the world.
title: Official: Meadows Had Been Warned of Possible 1/6 Violence
